title: Bamigboye, Nigeriaâ€™s Tour-de-Force Sculptor, Claims His Fame in the World
description: Yale University Art Gallery maps the surviving work of the Yoruban carver in his 50-year career bridging ritual and modern art. Attention is long overdue.
dc:creator: Holland Cotter
media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:description: Woodcarved masks for harvest festivals can weigh up to 80 pounds, at the Yale University Art Gallery. From left foreground, a mask created by the Nigerian sculptor Moshood Olusomo Bamigboye depicting a war general; another mask attributed to Bamigboye, depicting a ruler, and a third mask, by Bamigboye, depicting a war general.
